page.title: 03Trout Fishing,Ravensthorpe
page.content: The reservoir is divided into 2 by the causeway giving 2 seperate leisure pursuits.The larger eastern area is used for trout fishing. In 1984 Anglia Water Authority sold the fishing rights and so it became privately managed for the first time since fishing started here in 1952.The reservoir is stocked with 8000 brown and rainbow trout supplied by a hatchery in Arlesford Hants. Keen fly fishermen had already caught 4000 by June this year.They pay 6 pounds/day and can take 6 trout home if they can catch them.Some hire trout boats to increase their chances.Upto 200 fishermen come per week from as far away as London and Birmingham. Sometimes large pike weighing upto 20lb have been caught and these are sent to Billingsgate fish market in London.Fishing is a very popular sport.
